trikita.anvil

Class Anvil

  • java.lang.Object
    • trikita.anvil.Anvil

  • public final class Anvil
extends java.lang.Object
    Anvil class is a namespace for top-level static methods and interfaces. Most users would only use it to call Anvil.render(). Internally, Anvil class defines how Renderables are mounted into Views and how they are lazily rendered, and this is the key functionality of the Anvil library.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  Anvil.AttributeSetter<T> 
      static interface  Anvil.Renderable
      Renderable can be mounted and rendered using Anvil library.
      static interface  Anvil.ViewFactory

      • render

        public static java.util.concurrent.Future<?> render()
        Starts the new rendering cycle updating all mounted renderables. Update happens in a lazy manner, only the values that has been changed since last rendering cycle will be actually updated in the views. This method can be called from any thread, so it's safe to use Anvil.render() in background services.

      • mount

        public static <T extends android.view.View> T mount(T v,
                                                    Anvil.Renderable r)
        Mounts a renderable function defining the layout into a View. If host is a viewgroup it is assumed to be empty, so the Renderable would define what its child views would be.
        Parameters:
        v - a View into which the renderable r will be mounted
        r - a Renderable to mount into a View

      • unmount

        public static void unmount(android.view.View v)
        Unmounts a mounted renderable. This would also clean up all the child views inside the parent ViewGroup, which acted as a mount point.
        Parameters:
        v - A mount point to unmount from its View

      • unmount

        public static void unmount(android.view.View v,
                           boolean removeChildren)

      • currentView

        public static <T extends android.view.View> T currentView()
        Returns currently rendered View. It allows to access the real view from inside the Renderable.
        Returns:
        currently rendered View

      • render

        public static void render(android.view.View v)
